GOD.content: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)
GOD.linkedContent: repression & incorporation: either 2 economies, or one economy w/ 2 systems in move from mysterium to secretum (possibility of keeping the secret)

GOD.content: in the instant (no-time-lapse) when Abraham raises the knife, when he decides, instant of absolute sacrifice of economy, law of oikonomia, sacrifice of home, proper, one’s own kin
GOD.linkedContent: in the instant (no-time-lapse) when Abraham raises the knife, when he decides, instant of absolute sacrifice of economy, law of oikonomia, sacrifice of home, proper, one’s own kin

GOD.content: but God, who didn’t know what Abraham would do [here Kierkegaard Christianizes the story] reinscribes absolute sacrifice in an economy of reward w/ absolute gift (gives back Isaac)
GOD.linkedContent: but God, who didn’t know what Abraham would do [here Kierkegaard Christianizes the story] reinscribes absolute sacrifice in an economy of reward w/ absolute gift (gives back Isaac)

GOD.content: Jesus teaches in Matthew, “you can count on the heavenly economy if you sacrifice the earthly one”
GOD.linkedContent: Jesus teaches in Matthew, “you can count on the heavenly economy if you sacrifice the earthly one”

GOD.content: the 2 economies: 1) calculation, Judaic 2) dissymmetric economy of sacrifice, “beyond the totality of the calculable as a finite totality of the same,” renunciation of merchandise, still relies on giving back (rendre), on yield, profit, but only father who sees in secret [can calculate]
GOD.linkedContent: the 2 economies: 1) calculation, Judaic 2) dissymmetric economy of sacrifice, “beyond the totality of the calculable as a finite totality of the same,” renunciation of merchandise, still relies on giving back (rendre), on yield, profit, but only father who sees in secret [can calculate]

GOD.content: via Baudelaire’s “The Pagan School,” any exchange w/ purpose, any remuneration, slightest hint of calculation transforms gift into counterfeit money
GOD.linkedContent: via Baudelaire’s “The Pagan School,” any exchange w/ purpose, any remuneration, slightest hint of calculation transforms gift into counterfeit money

GT.content: soon as there is law, law of partition (partage), law as partition (moira), soon as there is nomy—there’s economy (oikonomia) > exchange, circulation, return (retour); figure of circle, amortization
GT.linkedContent: soon as there is law, law of partition (partage), law as partition (moira), soon as there is nomy—there’s economy (oikonomia) > exchange, circulation, return (retour); figure of circle, amortization

GT.content: oikonomia would always follow the path of Ulysses, return home to part chosen, destiny commanded (moira), the being-next-to-self of the Idea in absolute knowledge as odyssean, nostalgia of reappropriation
GT.linkedContent: oikonomia would always follow the path of Ulysses, return home to part chosen, destiny commanded (moira), the being-next-to-self of the Idea in absolute knowledge as odyssean, nostalgia of reappropriation

GT.content: gift interrupts economy, it’s not impossible but the impossible
GT.linkedContent: gift interrupts economy, it’s not impossible but the impossible

GT.content: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious
GT.linkedContent: be careful, ethically vigilant re: gift w/out debt, there’s calculation & ruse (economy) even in the unconscious

GT.content: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological
GT.linkedContent: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological

GT.content: one must render account of law that dissolves the gift in an Aufklarung of relational logic, that privileges, like Lévi-Strauss, the logic of exchange
GT.linkedContent: one must render account of law that dissolves the gift in an Aufklarung of relational logic, that privileges, like Lévi-Strauss, the logic of exchange

GT.content: the mapped-out signified of structuralism, a complementarity w/out supplement that conditions “exercise of symbolic thinking” > this is the rationality of the principle of reason
GT.linkedContent: the mapped-out signified of structuralism, a complementarity w/out supplement that conditions “exercise of symbolic thinking” > this is the rationality of the principle of reason

GT.content: laws turn gift into exchange, economy, contractual circulation, (distributive) justice
chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods
GT.linkedContent: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods

GT.content: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]
GT.linkedContent: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]

LOBL.content: from polysemia (economy) to dissemination; p. ~93 from critical to deconstruction
LOBL.linkedContent: from polysemia (economy) to dissemination; p. ~93 from critical to deconstruction

LOBL.content: is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?
LOBL.linkedContent: is double affirmation same as Freud’s triumph? wouldn’t this risk negativity of mourning, economic resentment, melancholia in “yes, yes”? can this be avoided?

LOBL.content: matter of economy (time, space, counting words, signs, marks) arrests translations
LOBL.linkedContent: matter of economy (time, space, counting words, signs, marks) arrests translations

LOBL.content: economy: stricture not coupure [pre-capitalist machine?], always external constraint that arrests a text in general, i.e. anything, for example life death
LOBL.linkedContent: economy: stricture not coupure [pre-capitalist machine?], always external constraint that arrests a text in general, i.e. anything, for example life death

LOBL.content: think exteriority from angle of economy of the arrêt: greatest “bound” energy, bandée, tightly gathered around its own limit (Hemmung, Haltung) > immediately disseminated, sand, empty, unloaded, spontaneously: in trance of trans, ghosts, transes, folies du jour (cf. Glas on trépas, trans/partition [Derrida’s referring to Genet crossing national borderlines])
LOBL.linkedContent: think exteriority from angle of economy of the arrêt: greatest “bound” energy, bandée, tightly gathered around its own limit (Hemmung, Haltung) > immediately disseminated, sand, empty, unloaded, spontaneously: in trance of trans, ghosts, transes, folies du jour (cf. Glas on trépas, trans/partition [Derrida’s referring to Genet crossing national borderlines])

H.content: always threatened by this dilemma: 1) when unconditional hospitality is circumscribed by economy of circle  (law, duty) [vs. ring?] 2) when unconditional hospitality dispenses w/ law
H.linkedContent: always threatened by this dilemma: 1) when unconditional hospitality is circumscribed by economy of circle (law, duty) [vs. ring?] 2) when unconditional hospitality dispenses w/ law

AF.content: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]
AF.linkedContent: Jew (or Devil, radical evil, all which is irreconcilable to God in “Christian science”) can be reinvested as an economistic resource of an archive that capitalizes everything [Sagi]

AF.content: devil can justify, such is destination of Jew in Aryan ideal
AF.linkedContent: devil can justify, such is destination of Jew in Aryan ideal

AF.content: haunting requires a home, a place, ghosts are sensitive to idioms, welcoming this one, allergic to that one > law of oikos, economy
AF.linkedContent: haunting requires a home, a place, ghosts are sensitive to idioms, welcoming this one, allergic to that one > law of oikos, economy

POOF.content: in Lysis, existence of friend for sake of enemy (ekthrou éneka) is abandoned for hypothesis of desire (épithumia): friend is friend of what he desires, the oikeiéotēs, home, habitat, familiar, property, hómoion, the present, near, neighbor > friend: everything an economy can reconcile
POOF.linkedContent: in Lysis, existence of friend for sake of enemy (ekthrou éneka) is abandoned for hypothesis of desire (épithumia): friend is friend of what he desires, the oikeiéotēs, home, habitat, familiar, property, hómoion, the present, near, neighbor > friend: everything an economy can reconcile

POOF.content: so, politics of friendship: w/out presence, w/out affinity, w/out analogy, aneconomic, truth & presence start to tremble
POOF.linkedContent: so, politics of friendship: w/out presence, w/out affinity, w/out analogy, aneconomic, truth & presence start to tremble

POOF.content: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?
POOF.linkedContent: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s gift must also belong to a finite world > how to think dissymmetry of gift w/out exchange, infinite disproportion, from vantage point of terrestrial finitude? under its horizon w/out horizon [see p. 263] > infinitization itself is suspected of being an economic ruse, perverse seduction, stratagem, of loving one’s neighbor

SEC.content: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation
SEC.linkedContent: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation

VM.content: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same

VM.content: preethical (if this can be said), transcendental violence institutes relationship btwn 2 finite ipseities, at the same time it’s nonviolence since it opens up relation to the other (an economy)
VM.linkedContent: preethical (if this can be said), transcendental violence institutes relationship btwn 2 finite ipseities, at the same time it’s nonviolence since it opens up relation to the other (an economy)

PP.content: [re: Socrates renouncing pleasure for truth] one must be careful, in symptamotological manner of Nietzsche, to diagnose the economy, l’investissement et le bénéfice différé sous le signe du pur renoncement, sous la mise du sacrifice désintéressé
PP.linkedContent: [re: Socrates renouncing pleasure for truth] one must be careful, in symptamotological manner of Nietzsche, to diagnose the economy, l’investissement et le bénéfice différé sous le signe du pur renoncement, sous la mise du sacrifice désintéressé

POS.content: differance never preceded by originary/indivisible unity of present that could be reserved as an expenditure calculated for reasons of economy
POS.linkedContent: differance never preceded by originary/indivisible unity of present that could be reserved as an expenditure calculated for reasons of economy

POS.content: differance is the general structure of economy, it is the economical concept
POS.linkedContent: differance is the general structure of economy, it is the economical concept

DPi.content: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious
DPi.linkedContent: unheimlich concept of belief: the believer (Glaübiger) who affects to believe is divided in belief, fiction of this simulacrum belongs to belief: skepsis, ēpokhē as believing itself > all economy traffics in act of faith: believing w/out believing, belief haunted by non-belief > quasi-hypnotic, quasi-hallucinatory, spectral, unconscious

DPi.content: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary
DPi.linkedContent: believing (like cruelty) has no contrary, thus is its own contrary

DPi.content: 1) being-unscathed (l’être-indemne): safe, sound, intact, virgin, heilig, unhurt, holy 2) becoming-indemnified (l’être-indeminsé): rendered unscathed again, reimbursed, redemption of debt
DPi.linkedContent: 1) being-unscathed (l’être-indemne): safe, sound, intact, virgin, heilig, unhurt, holy 2) becoming-indemnified (l’être-indeminsé): rendered unscathed again, reimbursed, redemption of debt

REST.content: why always say painting renders, restitutes?
REST.linkedContent: why always say painting renders, restitutes?

REST.content: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne
REST.linkedContent: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne

REST.content: pour aller, aller ensemble, ou aller-à > the 2 shoes must make a pair (aller à doesn’t mean se rendre à)
REST.linkedContent: pour aller, aller ensemble, ou aller-à > the 2 shoes must make a pair (aller à doesn’t mean se rendre à)

REST.content: Artaud (protests against ghosts): no ghosts in Van Gogh, no visions, the torrid truth, hieroglyphics > Derrida cautions: “you can only give them [the ghosts] back (rendre) if you think you have them, and you can only think you’re giving them if you haven’t got them”]
REST.linkedContent: Artaud (protests against ghosts): no ghosts in Van Gogh, no visions, the torrid truth, hieroglyphics > Derrida cautions: “you can only give them [the ghosts] back (rendre) if you think you have them, and you can only think you’re giving them if you haven’t got them”]

REST.content: annexing narcissism to fetishism, we’d never be finished, 4 forms of rendering: 1) render oneself in painting 2) render something to oneself, se payer 3) to go somewhere (se rendre quelque part) 4) given in to someone (se rendre à quelqu’un), surrender
REST.linkedContent: annexing narcissism to fetishism, we’d never be finished, 4 forms of rendering: 1) render oneself in painting 2) render something to oneself, se payer 3) to go somewhere (se rendre quelque part) 4) given in to someone (se rendre à quelqu’un), surrender

REST.content: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]
REST.linkedContent: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]

AFR.content: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Cohen] Judeo-Protestant Platonism or world logocentrism made spiritual families possible, genealogy w/out limit, general economy (oikonomia, oikos as the law itself) > spiritual mondialisation: logos, spirit, idealism as moral conscience of philosophy & science
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Cohen] Judeo-Protestant Platonism or world logocentrism made spiritual families possible, genealogy w/out limit, general economy (oikonomia, oikos as the law itself) > spiritual mondialisation: logos, spirit, idealism as moral conscience of philosophy & science

ATM.content: every present remains w/in the economic sphere of the same
ATM.linkedContent: every present remains w/in the economic sphere of the same

ATM.content: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy
ATM.linkedContent: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy

BSi.content: zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast
BSi.linkedContent: nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast

BSi.content: every economy & ecology presupposes limits, thresholds, and therefore (bunches of) keys
BSi.linkedContent: every economy & ecology presupposes limits, thresholds, and therefore (bunches of) keys

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s fort/da] law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s fort/da] law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary
